website_summaries.verdict: The Nikon Coolpix L22 looks good for its price, but there isn't much to like below the surface.
pros: pleasing color in photos under the right conditions

customer_reviews.title: Loved the camera but.
customer_reviews.text: I loved the camera, took great photos, compact and easy to use. But, not a good choice for kayaking. Popped out of my pocket when going ashore and never worked again. The new, waterproof replacement isn't as easy to use but has lasted through a lot of trips.
customer_reviews.author: Larry R. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good little camera.
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, my wife uses it all of the time and has had no problems. I think we have used it for about 5 years or more. I use my I Phone but she prefers this little camera. 12 Mega Pickles is plenty for most photos as long as your don't try to do professional photograph. y
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Compact and simple to use
customer_reviews.text: I got a great deal on this palm-sized little camera, and it's VERY easy to use, no 3000 page manual to wade through, small and light enough to keep in my bag or wear around my neck or over my shoulder on long hikes. The pictures are perfectly acceptable to me... I am not a professional by any means, but almost everything I've photographed has come out pretty well. Camera snobs would probably turn up their noses at this little camera, but for anyone looking for a compact and easy to use camera, I'd recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: GoddessOdd

customer_reviews.title: Nikon L22 Coolpix
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased this Nikon as a pocket camera, and it's GREAT for that purpose. I don't expect it to replace my Nikon D90 or My D3100, so I can accept it's limitations, but this is an amazing pocket camera that will take perfect pictures straight out of the box in minutes, if used correctly-(which is super easy). This camera cannot be beat for the money-the technology is awesome and the Nikon quality is there. So if you're looking for a great SMALL pocket camera that will take perfect pictures, the L22 is a great choice.The price is fantastic, so I purchased the oops protection plan in case I fumbled and dropped it-(it's pretty tiny for large hands). Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Bear 57

customer_reviews.title: This has been the best point and shoot i have ever had
customer_reviews.text: This has been the best point and shoot i have ever had. I normally carry a Nikon D7000 DSLR or a D80 DSLR and some pretty nice lens. This SMALL carry has been great when i couldn't carry the big iron or as a supplement to it.It has enough MP, good electronics and an acceptable lens system. I bought this because it was cheap, I needed a replacement for my Kodak Easyshare that suffered a drop. Till then I was a point and shoot Easyshare bigot. I needed it now, found this, took a chance. Both are good cameras but this one has some features I like.
customer_reviews.author: Techie customer

customer_reviews.title: Fairly good camera
customer_reviews.text: Features and specs are already covered in many reviews. Bought this for my mother and she is happy with it. Having really gotten blurry pics from it but I could understand it happening if your hands are not still. Also don't count on this camera to provide you instant photography there is some delay. Pros: 1. Low price for fairly great point and shoot specs. 2. Boot up time is very quick for such a low cost camera 3. Battery door seems sturdy for a low cost camera Cons: 1. Slight delay in processing pics 2. Camera feels cheap but at this price point it its fairly good 3. very Limited shooting options
customer_reviews.author: Shac

customer_reviews.title: Just the Replacement I needed! At a Fine Price, Too!
customer_reviews.text: So, I've ordered this "Black" Model of the L22 Coolpix because the "Red" Model lost its Zoom ability. I am was SO Freakin' happy that I bought this model for $30. The last model I had costed $120 or more from Best Buy, and That was a Decade ago (10 Years). I guess some cameras, no matter how well you take care of them, don't last as long as you like them to. Oh, well~.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. XIII

customer_reviews.title: Love the color choices
customer_reviews.text: Love that the quality is up to large with all these smart phones.. will work if your going for a more old school photo experience
customer_reviews.author: Jesica Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Value for money!!
customer_reviews.text: WOW! The camera looks great. I bought it to take pictures of my newborn child and got it just in time. I took all her first shots with it and I was not disappointed. Pros 1. Looks great 2. Great value for money 3. Good picture quality 4. Cool features which are a bonus Cons 1. You have to hold it really still inorder to avoid blurred pictures Solution: Practice to press the shot button half way before each picture) 2. Internal memory is a waste of time (it only holds about 5 pictures) Overall the camera is one of the better cameras below $100 if not the best.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I simply LOVE this camera. I am an over 50 year old artist. I wanted good quality pictures but I don't really understand the new technology. This camera is so easy to use and gets the quality I want in the pictures. You can even adjust certain elements to improve the picture even more to your liking. I would recommend this camera to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: L. Runkle

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: This Camera is perfect if you want great pictures without alot of complications or gadgets. It has a few buttons and it is simple to use. I wish I would have purchased this Nikon Coolpix L22 when it first came out. Im tired of all the other name brand digital cameras that have way too many features. With this camera you only need to read the manual once and your set to go. I also love the fact that it uses standard batteries and I don't have to charge it. It does not come with a memory card so I would recommend purchasing one with at least 4gb. It arrived when promised and in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia B

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Scores Again
customer_reviews.text: Great quality in a small package. Nikon has proven once again that you don't have to pay a lot for a great product. This camera has a simple menu structure, intuitive functionality, and takes great pictures. For any non-technical person who is just looking for a simple camera that takes excellent pictures, this is the one. It is simple enough to use without any instructions, but the PDF user manual that comes with the camera is very helpful in getting the most out of this camera. Cost is not the highest item on my priority list, but it is worth mentioning that this camera cost the least of all comparable competitors.
customer_reviews.author: David Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Overall good camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my 16 year old. We have had an older Nikon Coolpix for years and been happy with it. The screen, resolution, flash and battery life are much better on this newer model. The navigation button aren't as user friendly, easier to hit by accident, harder to switch modes. The buttons feel very flimsy and plastic - I'm worried they will break before the actual camera mechanisms do! But overall very satified. The pictures turned out well and it's a great camera for a teenager. I need a new camera too and think I will invest the extra 20-40 to get a slightly nicer coolpix that feels sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Garcia

customer_reviews.title: The best camera out there
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera back in 2011, and i still use it today. Its a pretty rad camera, and considering the price tag, you'd be a fool not to buy it. Lots of picture options, zoom is AMAZING, and the screen is a very good size for reviewing images. I've had my fair share of accidental droppings, and this camera still runs smoothly. The only problem i've EVER had with this camera is the batteries. Do not use cheap ones. Rechargeables, or Duracell, or even Energizer are the best ones. Cheap batteries only last for a few minutes, therefor shutting the camera off mid action.. Overall this camera is worth every penny. 10/10 would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Josie

customer_reviews.title: Coolpix Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera to augment an Olympus and Fuji that I already have and it is everything I wanted it to be. In my opinion the Nikon software is kind of Cheezy, but then so is the Olympus software, so...... Takes great pictures. My only negative would be that it seems to burn through batteries rather quickly, but that would be a minor issue for me. I'd certainly get another and give as gift to anyone wanting a digital camera!!! (I still like film, but it's getting fairly scarce and expensive when you do find it)....
customer_reviews.author: pj

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera, particularly for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Takes nice pictures, and I love the image stabilization. Takes quality pictures. Very good value.
customer_reviews.author: J L Parsons

customer_reviews.title: over all good but could be better.
customer_reviews.text: pros: high resolution photos with brillant colors, shoots best for still frames and landscapes. cons: can't seem to take a photo indoors without blurring, although it's relatively fast for taking digital photos it can't seem to take photos at parties or in other semi dim lighting (even with flash but especially without.) best for photoshoots, out doors and vacation snapshots. Over all a nice little camera has a number of 'auto shoot' modes (beach, portrait, sunset etc). no real manual options. A little pricey for what it is but a great back up camera.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Cool camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Coolpix mainly because I needed high resolution images on occasion, its a great camera, BUT, I have an iPod Touch 4G that I use almost exclusively. The reason that the Nikon sits in the backseat is: it doesn't have all the apps that can be added to the iPod Touch, simply, even with the low resolution images, the iTouch is better suited to the documentary style of work that I do. Worth the $$$ spent, but it doesn't let me enter text, e-mail, or post on my blog. If you want a very good "camera", GET one, Nikon Coolpix, that is . . .
customer_reviews.author: Salvidali

customer_reviews.title: Great camera so far.
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed so far with this camera, especially if it holds up for a long time. I have physically compared this camera to a Canon that costs forty dollars more and found the Nikon was capturing more details which to me means a better lens. The Canon might look better and be more space age, but this Nikon is more intuitive to me and has lots of great features. Easy to use I would definitely say. I could have easily given five stars as cant really find anything to fault. Bottom line to me with a camera is the level of detail found in pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Stevo

customer_reviews.title: Nikon impresses me again
customer_reviews.text: First-Praises to Amazon.com on delivery speed. I ordered this product on Dec 11th, 2010 and received it on Dec 14, 2010 with free shipping and handling. I have owned a Nikon small p&S before but sold it because I wanted a camera with more megapixels. The battery power so far has not let me down. The video quality is very good. The camera is very user friendly especially for someone like me that hates reading instructions. Cons= I don't like the fact that the memory card is stored at the same port as the two batteries. Zoom photo quality is grainy.
customer_reviews.author: M. Massey

customer_reviews.title: Might be me
customer_reviews.text: Still learning about photography so the focus issues might be me
customer_reviews.author: Ruby G

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: The camera works as promised and I'm pleased with the pictures. The menus are not very intuitive, but with patience I'm figuring everything out. The only thing I don't really like is that the printed manual is only enough to get you started; the full manual needs to be loaded from the CD onto your computer. This is a bit inconvenient because I usually need it in the field as questions come up during use, but I understand in this day and age everything is as digital as possible. I'll adapt. Other than that, I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard C.

customer_reviews.title: In love with this camera!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am in absolute love with this camera! My old one, which I had for about 6 years finally went on the brink after being dragged all over the world. I bought this one for a third of the price as my last one! I've been taking wonderful pictures in the tropics of the Philippines with it and I couldn't want for a better camera. So easy to use, high picture quality, light weight. No complaints! Oh, and it shipped quickly as well! I had it three days after ordering it!
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy K.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Point & Shoot
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera due to the high rating in Consumer's Report. I have been very impressed with the results. The camera is small and lightweight but takes excellent pictures including low light and fast moving subjects. I like the fact that you can override automatic settings if you want and the auto bracketing features that ensures the subject you want to take a photo of is in focus. ( The camera, somehow, is able to tell where the faces of people are )
customer_reviews.author: Bingaman

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera, Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera, and have waited almost a year to write a review because I wanted to get as much field use out of it as I could before I put my opinion out into the world. This is an excellent camera for several reasons. Battery Life is excellent, picture quality is amazing, and the size is just wonderful. I am required to take pictures of the construction jobsites that my company works on and this camera has made my life a whole lot easier. The menu to access information that I want added to each picture is simple and very intuitive. A novice should have no problem with using this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Coolpix  L22 Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Nikon Camera when my old one (only 6 months) LCD display screen broke. Nikon would not warranty the screen replacement so I could purchase a new camera for less than to fix the old one. I was originally going to purchase another brand of digital camera but Amazon had such a good deal I could not say no. This camera itself is easy to use. Quality of the LCD screen is only ok, quite grainy. The speed to take pictures if also slow, not as good as the old camera. Last item, I wish it came with a lithium battery, but no luck. Overall an okay camera, but check around on the price.
customer_reviews.author: C. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a birthday gift for someone who wanted to experiment with an easy to use camera. The Nikon Coolpix fit the bill -- and then some. Features are impressive .... the learning curve is easy ... the camera is small and lightweight. The reason I gave the battery life only three stars is because that is an unknown factor at this point, and there is no n/a option. Highly recommended for anyone looking for an outstanding everyday digital camera.
customer_reviews.author: critic

customer_reviews.title: Charging Port Broke
customer_reviews.text: Have had the camera for a little over a year but have only used it maybe 6 times. Trying to plug in the charger and the port is too loose now, cant charge camera anymore.
customer_reviews.author: RedRocker1963

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera served me so well and still does when I don't use my phone (phones may soon be to cameras what the internet is becoming to TV!). I only stopped using it because the battery door latch broke, so I had to start sticking it with tape or wrapping an elastic hair band to hold it down - not tres classy. However, it's still working!
customer_reviews.author: NikkiB

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal, Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought an older model Coolpix camera for my teenage son. It was a great camera until his 5 yr. old brother pounded on the lens to get it to go back in. This L22 12.0 MP was his replacement. We trust the quality from Nikon and have been pleased with the Coolpix cameras. My Canon camera was $300+ and this camera takes just as good of pictures for a lot less money. The price from Amazon was unbeatable so I bought 2 and gave one to my other teenage kid. I highly recommend this camera!
customer_reviews.author: kelseycrew

customer_reviews.title: Battery cover breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my girlfriend two months ago. She has barely used it and has definitely not abused it. Today I took it out the the case and notice that the battery cover is open. The extremely thin piece of plastic that's supposed to hold the latch is cracked and broke off. What a terrible design. This camera was great so far but now its essentially garbage. Do not buy this camera. It will NOT last.
customer_reviews.author: Fake name real review

customer_reviews.title: I Loved This Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera was my best friend in the woods and at celebrations. I carried it everywhere, it took great pictures in the worst conditions. I eventually sold it to a friend because she needed a decent camera to take pictures of her girls. She was extremely happy with it and I got nearly a full return on the purchase price. This camera is a winner in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Lee Cain

customer_reviews.title: Slow but OK
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera as a gift for someone. As we used it over the holidays we were dissapointed with the number of great shots that we missed because of the slow reaction time to pushing the shutter button. Some of the pics we did get were blurry since we thoght the picture was already taken when in actuality it was not. It is a good feeling camera as far as weight and compatness. The flash has sufficient power for a small camera.
customer_reviews.author: David Y. Chomitzky

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Nikon camera. The first one I had for 5 years and it worked great, so I wanted another Nikon. The Coolpix L22 is great, especially for the price. I'm not into photography or anything, just taking pictures on vacations, at events, holidays, etc., and I love it, small, lightweight, easy to use and excellent picture quality! Delivery was quick and easy, came earlier than expected and at the time I purchased the camera, early October 2010, it was the cheapest around...even cheaper than Wal-Mart!
customer_reviews.author: jennifr80

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want an expensive camera. I am not a professional photographer and I don't need professional quality pics/video. This is great for taking everyday pics like at a concert or outdoors and etc. This is a good digital camera and it is also my first. I would recommend this to first time camera buyers. I wouldn't recommend this to people looking for HD quality and crystal clear quality.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Great starter camera
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera for my mother who has never owned a digital camera or computer in her life. It was very easy for me to explain to her how to use it and she seemed to pick up on it quickly. So far she's been very happy with it and has begun taking photo's with this instead of using disposable cameras. For the price you can't beat it. For those who want any advanced controls and features this camera might be a bit of a dissapointment. It is definately tailored as a simple automatic point and shoot.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Breckle

customer_reviews.title: Good camera
customer_reviews.text: Nice, durable camera well suited for point and shoot and especially good for children. Has different features for taking photos such as different modes to put it in. My only issue with it is that for children to use they need to be taught to hold it VERY still when snapping the photo or the photo is blurry. Other than that it is a good camera. We used rechargeable batteries in it and that works well.
customer_reviews.author: E. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Great for Snapshots
customer_reviews.text: I'm a professional photographer, but I don't always want to lug my expensive camera and camera bag everywhere that I go. If i just want to capture those "Kodak" moments with the family or do still pix of subjects that aren't moving, I can do that with this 12 MP digital camera. It was new, arrived on time, and the price was better than anything in any store anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Larry V. Reitz Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great gift
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this camera as a gift for someone who is not really a heavy technology user and was planning to go on vacation with a classic film camera. Needless to say this was a really good purchase, and the red color is a really nice touch and is the first compliment you will get. Camera was super easy to setup, just insert the memory card and battery and you are ready to point and click. Picture quality is good enough that you will not really complain unless you are super picky and are a professional, but for most intents and purposes this is a great buy. Makes a great gift for anyone really.
customer_reviews.author: Dhruv Thukral

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Camera
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased this camera I was looking for a reasonable priced camera that would give me the photo quality I wanted with ease of operation. This Nikon fills the bill. For the money I don't believe you could find a better camera. The pictures are great and it's really simple to use. I am really pleased with this one. If the need arises I'll buy another Nikon in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Rodster

customer_reviews.title: nikon
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera for my boyfriend for our anniversary. I am a photographer personally but he has never had a camera so since hes always borrowing my Nikon coolpix i decided to get a cheaper version of mine since hes still new at it and i think this was perfect, he loves it, its very simple to use,and a great price. Only problem we had was the focusing was a little off but still great and decent.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: What can I say about this camera other than... Wow. I did not expect such quality for the money I paid, even though it was advertised as "factory reconditioned", you might as well be buying a brand new camera. I highly recommend this product for anyone wanting a quality digital camera with all the bells and whistles for a price you can truly afford.
customer_reviews.author: Ehab A. Ali

customer_reviews.title: good value sharp images
customer_reviews.text: this camera has a lot of good high tech features that really make it simple to take a perfect picture every time in a well lit environment. Pros: Its a good value. Gets the job done nicely. such pretty pictures of my car lol. Easy integration with software plugging into my laptop to move the pictures and edit them. cons: doesn't do well with moving objects especialy at night. like most cameras i guess it eats up batteries like crazy. Needs a memory card ofcourse.
customer_reviews.author: shaun

customer_reviews.title: Warranty a Joke
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my mother-in-law. She treats the camera like it is Gold and even uses a camera case etc. The battery door latch will not stay shut. She returned it under warranty and they will not repair. They claim "impact damage" and want $75 to repair a $100 camera and $13 to return it either way. Next time (which looks like soon since the camera is not useable) I will buy a Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Burke

customer_reviews.title: NIKON COOLPIX L22
customer_reviews.text: I have been thinking of what to say when reviewing this camera. I could repeat all the greatness of what other reviews have already said... but I think if I just share one thing, in conjunction with the other reviews, it will sum the Coolpix up. I am legally blind, and I can take great pictures with this camera. ABSOLUTELY would buy it again!!!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome camera. Takes GREAT pictures. I bought mine used, so I paid less than $30 for it. Great deal, since it only showed slight wear and works good as a new one. If it were a cheap brand camera, I would not have been willing to go used, but I trust Nikon. Excellent camera.
customer_reviews.author: DonnaV

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera for a low price
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this prior to a vacation this summer. The camera functioned very well. Daylight photos were almost as good as my digital slr. Low light needed the subjects to be still and a steady hand. Great value for the money. The extra optical zoom set this camera ahead of the pack. Most in the class only have 3x this one has 3.8x. The fact that it takes standard AA batteries was a huge plus when the recharagble batteries ran out. You will need to buy your own rechargable batteries and charger this unit does not come with them. Many in this class do. This is my only knock.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bellouny

customer_reviews.title: A gift for a non-technical elderly person
customer_reviews.text: This camers is very easy to handle. Size and weight are perefect and battery use requires no charger. Memory chip is available and can easily be downloaded. Best is that the two top buttons ( on-off and focus-snap ) are all that is needed when camera is set for automatic operation, including flash ) My gift was received with great enthusiasm and has been put to full use immediately.- and it takes pictures with good color rendition and excellent clarity.
customer_reviews.author: HSH

customer_reviews.title: Good for its price
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this camera to replace the Nikon I dropped and broke. This camera is a less advanced version than the one I broke. It's not a great camera, but it is definitely a good camera for the price. I have no complaints. If I wanted more features, etc., I would have bought a higher model, but I needed a camera in a hurry, and it was available and affordable. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a basic, point-and-shoot digital camera.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Broken battery compartment
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed that the battery compartment latch broke before I had the chance to shot 50 pictures. Cost of replacement is pointless. Seems replacing the regular batteries were too frequent and dead whenever I went to use it. Next time I will buy a camera with a battery with a charger. My other Nikon lasted for years. I loved it. But this one....maybe I just got unlucky this time.
customer_reviews.author: BizzeB

customer_reviews.title: Dont trust seller.
customer_reviews.text: This camera is a good product. We've had one before that worked great for years. This one we bought used and seller had it listed in "good" condition. But the battery door latch was broken and will not stay closed with the batteries in place.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: so so
customer_reviews.text: I like to take pics of fall foliage. When the leaves are yellow on a bright day they give off a very special glow - which is not captured correctly on the camera screen. But the pictures are correct when downloaded. But - considering the price - not bad at all. See this page - all the pictures were taken with this camera. [...]
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Photo Pal
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for teenage Grandaughter's birthday. I have purchased similar cameras for other of my grandchildren, and have found that even 'entry-level-plus' grade cameras from Nikon are a cut above the competition. I believe that photography is an acquired skill, and getting good quality photographs during the learning process avoids the discouragement that often accompanies cheap camera results.. Nikon doesn't install sub-par lenses. The versatility of digital cameras has enabled new snapshot artists to grow into accomplished photographers much sooner than in the film photo era.. PLUS it is a pretty camera that a teenager can be proud of using..
customer_reviews.author: Ivison D. Rowland

customer_reviews.title: Takes great photos. However
customer_reviews.text: Takes great photos. However, disappointed that there is a clear design flaw in the battery door. There is a plastic ledge that the battery door latches to. Once the ledge breaks, the door will no longer latch. I found several on Ebay with the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Broken Battery door lach
customer_reviews.text: The battery door latch broke when I replaced the batteries and Nikon will not fix the camera. This was the second set of batteries and the camera is only 2 months old. Nikon service basically said I did not know how to replace the batteries and broke the door latch. This is a very simple process to replace the batteries and the camera worked for a few pictures after I replaced the batteries then the door flew open and would not stay closed because the little Plastic latch hook broke off. We have been replacing batteries for our previous camaras for more than 10 years in the exactly the same way but never had one broken.
customer_reviews.author: paula

customer_reviews.title: A good camera for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It's just that, a good camera for the price. Pros: Takes great pictures, price is lower than comparable 12.1MP point-and-shoot cameras, unlike many other cameras I've used the auto-sensor for photo type actually works well. Cons: Takes forever to actually take the picture, not really small, does not come with a rechargeable installed battery, eats batteries (I bought rechargeable AA cells and carry two changes worth.)
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Doherty

customer_reviews.title: Design Flaw!!
customer_reviews.text: Decent pictures but very cheap battery compartment latch. I went through two of these cameras and they both failed due to the flimsy, tiny plastic latch breaking off. After this breaks, you can't keep batteries in the camera.
customer_reviews.author: E. Bischoff

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Coolpix L22 camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this little camera! It makes me look like I know what I am doing. Taking pictures is really fun now, and I see things in a different way, because of this little point and shoot camera. I can get really clear close-ups of flowers and birds, that I could never get before. This camera has many features that I haven't even used yet, but I will continue to learn what this camera can do. It's a great little camera at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Queen of Green

customer_reviews.title: Battery Life is not very long!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera but the only problem I have is the battery life. I only used the camera to take pics twice, turning the camera off after every use. The third time I tried to use my camera it did not come on because the battery was too low. I strongly suggest keeping a set of batteries near by when using this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Diva4diva

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.text: I don't think I could go back to not having this camera. It focuses very well, and takes beautiful pictures. Not professional quality, but excellent for snapping pictures on vacation, or of your family. It's compact, and easy to use. The price was perfect! I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Hikaroo

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Coolpix L22
customer_reviews.text: We use this camera as a carry with to grab off hand photos, and it does a great job, pixs are clear and color good. I can not comment on the movie capabilities and have not thus far taken many dark indoor shots, but none of the shots we have taken are throwaways. We would recommend this camera to a friend
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: Not satisfied at all!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this camera for my mom for Christmas last year. Already having problems with it! It drains the batteries, even when they are taken out and put in the camera right before getting ready to use it, she is only able to take about 20 pictures and then it says the batteries are exhausted. Also have problems with the pictures it takes. They turn out yellow and blurry. The camera is only able to be returned through Amazon for 30 days, so now we either have to contact the manufacturer or be out $90. Not my idea of a good purchase!
customer_reviews.author: danielleh

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: cheap poorly built camera, still have it my mom uses it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Ramsumare

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera For The Price
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely pleased with the quality and durability of this little camera. I personally like the fact that it uses standard batteries available at almost any retailer so it's always "ready to go". Picture quality is comparable to any other compact camera I've used.
customer_reviews.author: Outdoor Enthusiast

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my nephew for Christmas and he loves it. The only thing I missed was noticing that the camera didn't come with either and case or a memory card. My nephew, who is 13, didn't have much fun on Christmas taking pictures without a memory card but I quickly went online to get him one which was only seven dollars. I also got him a case in matching blue for twelve dollars and now he's set to go. The picture has a great screen and the colors and clarity of his pictures are really nice, maybe even better than my 4 year-old Cannon.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Landry

customer_reviews.title: Nikon L22
customer_reviews.text: I had no problems with delivery, in fact the package arrived 2 days early. The camera (with Ikelite housing) is going to be a nice asset to my business as we take many underwater photos for the projects we do. The vibration reduction feature is an added bonus, as it is hard to find a solid platform while diving, to take your shots. So far I am very pleased with the overall outcome.
customer_reviews.author: Troxman

customer_reviews.title: My friend really loved blue Nikon Coolpix L22MP Digital Camera was very best ...
customer_reviews.text: My friend really loved blue Nikon Coolpix L22MP Digital Camera was very best for limit and very rare. Blue was very popular than other color. Blue Nikon Coolpix L22 MP Digital camera is high price for very rare.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Yuh

customer_reviews.title: Had to return it.
customer_reviews.text: Had to return, as bought it for a gift for my mom, and even though it advertised a big screen, it was way small, and no instructions or batteries came with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kari McGrath

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Camera Coolpix L22
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my sister - as she loves the one I own. VERY easy to use, great pictures and lots of options, including movie function. I wish they charged a little more for the product and included a SD card. You will have to purchase the card separately. I bought it for a Christmas gift and if I had realized this, I would have purchased the card in advance. We had her open it first so she could take photos of the gift opening - and the camera without the card only holds about 4 pictures! Great value for the price and very compact for carrying anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: GrammaChex

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: This is a Great camera. Purchased for my mom... for her birthday. She hasn't had any problems with it. It takes great pictures!
customer_reviews.author: Seth Davis

customer_reviews.title: Battery door design flaw
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera from Amazon in December, 2010. It worked pretty well for about 18 months. Then the battery compartment door started refusing to stay closed. Apparently, a small piece of plastic that formed the latch had broken. The camera had not been dropped or abused. I believe it happened in the course of normal wear. While I was happy with the camera in all other respects, I believe the battery door problem to be a serious design flaw, and that is the reason for my 1-star rating. If you get one of these, handle the battery compartment door with kid gloves!
customer_reviews.author: Mortimer Snerd

customer_reviews.title: L22
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it is easy to use and small enough to fit into a shirt pocket which will be invaluable assets when I travel overseas. I preferred this compact camera to an SLR because this gives me great pictures without the nuisance of a bulky camera which has multiple features I would never use.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Best camera for baby photos for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This camera has been a lifesaver. We were taking photos with our cell phones and they were good, but after getting a professional photo session and seeing the difference in quality (and the package costing an arm and a leg) we decided to get a camera of our own. The quality is outstanding! It is effortless to take portrait photos, make videos, snap a picture once a smile appears, and shoot panoramic shots. I am so glad we got this camera (the color is cute too!)
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Goeller

customer_reviews.title: Cool Camera
customer_reviews.text: Review written by my 6 year old son, "my camera is the best. It can take the most pictures on the 16-9 picture taking mode. When you are pointing at someone a yellow square will appear and it will focus on the face even if you move it somewhere else and the face is still on the screen focused. You just push this button it's a box with an arrow in it and then you can scroll with the arrow keys which are not basically arrow keys and then you can hold it down and it will go really fast. And you can put it in sports mode. I recommend this camera to people who don't have cameras."
customer_reviews.author: Online in Iowa

customer_reviews.title: Nice, crisp images
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. My previous camera didn't take the best pictures but it was cheap and I carry it with me all the time. We were going on vacation and the price was too good to pass up. This camera even takes good pictures from the back of a motorcycle! I recommend it highly. It is easy to use and compact.
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: Great buy, I shopped around comparing the price for this camera and got the best price here. The iteam area fast and as described. Beautiful camera and simple to use, have only taken a few pictures this far, but excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Charles K. Stroud

customer_reviews.title: Nikon camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera with all necessary features for beginner (and even more advanced). I purchased this camera as a gift for my friend, and it works great. It looks like the best combination of quality and price. Also, I received this camera in no time - literally, on next day.
customer_reviews.author: Sergey Trofimenko

customer_reviews.title: I like the camera itself but within six months of purchasing ...
customer_reviews.text: I like the camera itself but within six months of purchasing it the little plastic clasp that holds the batteries tight broke. I've been wrapping a rubber band around it ever since...
customer_reviews.author: P. J. Harris

customer_reviews.title: ... self works really well and the pictures are really good. However the battery cover is made out of ...
customer_reviews.text: Camer it self works really well and the pictures are really good. However the battery cover is made out of cheap plastic and breaks, making it hard to keep the batteries in and functional.
customer_reviews.author: Janet H

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: I needed a replacement for a much older (2003) Nikon Coolpix model. It has very similar menus and functions, so it was easy to adapt to, great image quality (compared to my previous model) and I'm happy with the size, as well as the fact it takes SD cards (as opposed to the CF cards).
customer_reviews.author: Cicindelidae

customer_reviews.title: It is really just okay
customer_reviews.text: It is a very entry level Nikon. I mean really almost a point and shoot. the 3.6x Optical Zoom is just better than nothing. But, everything is backed by the big name, the quality of the assembly and lenses. It's okay!
customer_reviews.author: John Giordani

customer_reviews.title: My first digital camera
customer_reviews.text: and I love it. It's a cool little device, takes gorgeous pictures, and has a ton of options. Coupled with an alright price and an easy to use interface, and you have a winner. The only cons for me, it uses AA batteries, I kinda wanted a rechargeable, but it's not a big deal. And don't forget to get an SD card since it doesn't come with one.
customer_reviews.author: RichieRaw

customer_reviews.title: My boyfriend likes it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my man and now he loves it. The only thing I didnt pay attention to before buying this camera was I didnt know it required AA batteries, thats the only thing that bothers me other than that the user manual is very easy to understand and in fact the camera is cool and easy 2 use. I'd recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Kisha

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect .... Looked like it was brand new - no scratches or dents.
customer_reviews.author: RgmB

customer_reviews.title: It was used at a recent wedding with great results
customer_reviews.text: I needed aa easy to use camera and have owned Nikons in the past. I found this camera had all the features I desired except for one and it is the lack of a printed users handbbook. Going to the internet or a CD to find a solution was quite unhandy.
customer_reviews.author: John Garland

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Cool Pix L22
customer_reviews.text: This camera was purchased in September 2010 on amazon.com and initially I liked it very much. For an inexpensive camera it performed quite well. Flash photos at night were a problem and they tended to be underexposed. There were and are occasional automatic focus issues where the photos are blurry even if the camera is held steady. Recently it started eating batteries and the battery case pops open at the most inconvenient times. The lock is not broken but it is not strong enough to contain the batteries. It is a real nuisance trying to take a photo and have the batteries fall out. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Ibbotson

customer_reviews.title: Great point and shoot !!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little camera (for the money) but then I'd expect nothing less from Nikon. Sharp clear images both indoors and out. Straight forward ease of use, perfect size, hand weight, and more than adequate LCD screen. I love this little camera!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very user friendly
customer_reviews.text: I have an older version of this camera. I bought this one for my father because of how much I liked mine. He had never used a digital camera before but didn't have much trouble figuring out how to use all the features. If I had one complaint, the buttons are very small and he has to put glasses on to see what he's pushing, but I suppose that's the sacrifice you make for a compact item. Overall, this is a great purchase and a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Bligh

customer_reviews.title: I would pick this camera again
customer_reviews.text: This camera is great - the pictures are really nice. The only drawback is that the shutter speed is a little slow or it would have gotten 5 stars - however in this price range I think that was the tradeoff.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly BOOK FREAK

customer_reviews.title: Excellent point and shoot camera
customer_reviews.text: I have several Nikon L series cameras. They all work great and this is no exception. The large view screen is easy to see outside which helps me on trips across country.
customer_reviews.author: KSArnold

customer_reviews.title: i am happy!
customer_reviews.text: Small but worth it! The camera is all what I expected, but it is on the small size. It will drain batteries if you buy the cheaper ones, but otherwise, i am happy!
customer_reviews.author: Nyema

customer_reviews.title: Nice -- easy to use -- great results
customer_reviews.text: This was my camera of choice when I went on a tour of England. Nice -- easy to use -- great results.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Lee

customer_reviews.title: Nice Nilon
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat this camera for the money! I paid $80 with free shipping. It does tend to over expose a little with the flash but that is easy to fix with the exposure compansation settings. The videos are not HD 19/9 but it does a good job for facebook or you tube. I can take 25 minutes of video with a 32gig card. But this camera is not made for video it was just an add on. Use the camera to take point and shoot pictures. I love slr's but can't afford a digital one at this time. This camera will fill in until I upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Jerrold Wharton

customer_reviews.title: Great camera.
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes true to life pictures with great colors. I really love it and did not expect such great photos from such a cheap camera. It my favorite all time camera.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: great camera
customer_reviews.text: I desperately needed a new camera and I wanted one that is easy to use and takes great pictures. This camera is great for me. It is simple to use and takes great pictures. The only thing about it that I noticed right away is that it does not have a viewfinder, just the screen. For me this is not a big deal so overall I love my new camera!
customer_reviews.author: CinnyB

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camera just a month and have taken about 20 photos so far, all on Easy Mode. I've had just one poor photo and that occurred when I shot down a slight incline between some trees where there was an interplay of sun and shade. It's a breeze to operate. I wish it was a bit thicker so I could grip it better. It's perfect, though, for small hands.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph P. Parrinello

customer_reviews.title: Battery compartment failed
customer_reviews.text: Worked great until the latch stopped working and the batteries kept falling out.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Compact & Simple
customer_reviews.text: Nothing fancy just a nice, compact camera. I'm still a little old fashioned when it comes to these digital cameras. I don't like the pause in the shutter. I find it hard to keep the camera steady. That's not saying anything bad about this one.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: great camera
customer_reviews.text: I have this camera and I am very happy with it. it has sports mode which is great because I love taking pictures of fast movement. It takes .92 seconds with flash, and 1.34 seconds with no flash there is 18 picture modes and it also records 25 minutes of video. About 5 hours of battery life. (takes 2 double A batteries) the one thing that I don't like is how long it takes to delete. I wouldn't worry about that though.
customer_reviews.author: jjb09

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: What can I say its easy to use the price was right and its now 3 yeard old. Best part it takes Std AA batteries. Use the energizer litium they last a year
customer_reviews.author: SteveV

product_meta.title: Nikon Coolpix L22 12.0MP Digital Camera with 3.6x Optical Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Red-primary)
product_meta.description:
Color:RedFROM THE MANUFACTURER


 Make memories and share joy with Nikon's new high-resolution Coolpix L22 and its 12.0 effective megapixels, 3.6x zoom and huge, bright 3.0-inch LCD. Nikon's 3-way VR Image Stabilization System automatically detects subject movement and adjusts the shutter speed and ISO to compensate for camera shake and minimize image blur. The camera's Easy Auto Mode with Scene Auto Selector simplifies your picture-taking experience by letting camera automatically select the best setting to get great pictures. Nikon's Smart Portrait System will; fix red-eye, detect faces, fire the shutter when your subject smiles and warn you if they blink, to get you great portraits. 



Carefree operation and high performance combined for consistently great pictures 

Combining the precision optics of a Nikkor lens with the image quality and performance benefits of Nikon's innovative EXPEED digital image-processing concept, the Coolpix L22 is a quality compact digital camera that combines high performance with outstanding operating ease. 

Intuitive and automated operation ensures carefree command over the high performance features of the Coolpix L22. Activated in Easy Auto Mode, Nikon's Scene Auto Selector makes capturing special moments as easy as turning on the camera and shooting without worrying about any settings. Electronic VR image stabilization, Motion Detection, Nikon's BSS (Best Shot Selector) function and ISO 1600 capability help ensure sharper results in lower light, or when capturing fast-moving subjects. 

The Coolpix L22 is powered by AA size/R6 batteries, for the added advantage of being able to pick up a new set in virtually any corner of the world. The Coolpix L22 provides reassuring freedom from any worries about recharging or running out of power when a special shutter chance presents itself. 

The large high-resolution 3-inch LCD monitor offers a bright image that is a pleasure to view, even outdoors. Controls are sized and placed to ensure intuitive operation. For example, dedicated buttons on the back of the body make it easy to switch between shooting and playback modes. And the contours of the large thumb rest and the body itself assure a solid grip. Design is just one aspect of the Coolpix L22 that combines beauty and functionality. 

Nikon Coolpix L22 Feature Highlights 

EXPEED digital imaging technology
Nikon's smarter approach to digital imaging technology. From image capture to processing, Nikon's comprehensive EXPEED digital imaging concept encompasses the entire picture-taking operation. EXPEED is much more than a processing engine; it is a revolution in digital photography. 

Intelligent automation contributes to carefree shooting
Easy Auto Mode simplifies photography by taking control of settings; just turn on the camera and shoot freely. Activated in Easy Auto Mode, Nikon's Scene Auto Selector eliminates the need to manually select a scene mode to match the shot, making it faster and easier to capture the moment in beautiful fashion. The Coolpix L22 and L21 use this intelligent function to analyze the subject and its surrounding settings and automatically select the most appropriate scene mode to achieve optimal results. 

Advanced image stabilizing features* help ensure sharper results Nikon's Electronic VR image stabilization and Motion Detection compensate for subject movement as well as camera shake. Nikon's original BSS (Best Shot Selector) function automatically shoots a series of sequential frames and saves the one with the sharpest focus.
* The camera selects and uses only the features required to optimize each image. 





Nikon's exclusive Smart Portrait System
Automatically detecting as many as 12 faces in the shot, Face-priority AF helps produce satisfying portraits by adjusting focus and exposure. Smart Portrait Mode* helps to faithfully record precious moments by automatically releasing the shutter when the subject smiles. Blink Warning displays an alert when it suspects that a subject has blinked. In-Camera Red-Eye Fix automatically corrects perceived red-eye effect before saving the image to memory.
*The Smart Portrait Mode function for the Coolpix L22, L22 and L21 operates in the same fashion as the Smile Mode function for other models. 

Nikon Coolpix L22 Other Features  * Macro shooting from as close as 5 cm (2 in.) 
 * ISO 1600 
 * 16 scene modes for optimized shooting in various settings 
 * D-Lighting 
 * Two movie modes with sound 
 * Approx. 19 MB of internal memory 

What's in the Box  * LR6/L40 (AA-size) alkaline batteries x2 
 * UC-E6 USB Cable 
 * AN-CP19 Strap 
 * Coolpix Software Suite CD-ROM
feature_bullets: 12.0 megapixels for stunning prints as large as 16 x 20 inches
3.6x Zoom-NIKKOR glass lens (37mm to 134mm); bright 3.0-inch LCD
Easy Auto Mode with Scene Auto Selector; capture 640 x 480 movies with sound at 30fps
EXPEED Image Processing; Smart Portrait System

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars697 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
